author: phil.lewis
title: Multi-Round Proposals
description: Можем ли мы увеличить участие в голосовании, сократив объем предложений с помощью многораундового процесса отбора.

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The proposal aims to address the problem of voting participation, which is related to Fund8 strategic goals: grow the number of contributors and make Cardano into an open-source project.

At the same time, this challenge is defined as an experiment to test a specific solution idea (multi-round). However, it does not go into the details to:
1) provide an overview of specific cases with historical examples that lead to lower participation.
2) analyze alternative solutions to the same problem.
3) present a cost/benefit analysis suggesting that the chosen solution is the optimal one, etc.

In my opinion, this proposal would be stronger if it spent more time to precisely and with examples define the issues of the current system and to formulate a call for proposed solutions from the community instead of defining a solution itself.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of the problem.
- 1 point for the lack of a discusion about the relative size of the use cases and their importance for Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of a clear analysis of alternative approaches.
My rating is 2.
f6_assessments.q1:
Implementing the proposed experiment with multi-round selection is simple.

The only blocker that I can see is that the software we use right now (Idea Scale, etc.) might not have the needed  functionality yet.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of specific analysis of the problem and key use cases.
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q2:
The defined metric (unique voting wallets) can help track progress.

At the same time, this single metric is not sufficient to:
1) Understand the incremental contribution of this specific challenge to the growth of voting wallets. The wallets can grow simply because the ecosystem growths.
2) The satisfaction of the community with the new process in comparison with the alternative approaches.
3) the impact of higher participation in voting on quicker progress towards cardano's mission.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solution.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge aligns with Fund 8 Strategic Goal of prepare a group of people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than 1 of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The technical and more significantly financial hurdles of holding 3 votes should be addressed in the challenge brief. Who is going to setup all these votes and what community oversight is there for these organizers? The challenge is borderline between a challenge and a proposal. Perhaps making the challenge about creating alternative voting mechanisms that are more scalable and have higher participation rates and then submit the 3 vote system as a proposal under that challenge might be a better approach.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and key metrics are very one dimensional however they meet a minimal progress measurement. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the metrics can measure progress towards the success criteria.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge is proposed to experiment another way for making a decision, using a three round vote instead of the one round vote we currently use. This is a fundamental change to Catalyst Process, atnd I agree that it would be valuable to experiment alternate voting schemes. 
However, as this challenge brief has no specific theme, it could weaken the whole Catalyst process by removing proposals from the challenge they actually belong to.
f6_assessments.q1: This challenge as no specific theme, and aims at experimenting a new voting process. For this reason I disagree that it will successfully bring good quality proposals and foster voting.
f6_assessments.q2:
As explained above, this challenge is a proposal for an alternate decision making and not a challenge with a specific theme. 
Nevertheless, a higher number of unique wallet vote -compared to other challenges vote- does not look like an appropriate metric for the quality of an alternate voting process. It is a measure of the attractivity of an alternate voting process. 
I would suggest the proposer to build a metric that would measure the quality of a distributed decision, based on the same decision inputs but experimenting various voting process.

importance: Объем предложений не позволяет избирателям участвовать в принятии решения (положительного или отрицательного) в отношении всех из них.
success: Количество кошельков, голосующих за предложения, увеличивается по сравнению с другими типами вызовов.
